conclusion: Snell's Law is used to relate the angles of incidence and refraction with the refractive index of the medium.
Snell's Law formula is given as \( \frac{\sin i}{\sin i'} = n \), where \(i\) is the angle of incidence, \(i'\) is the angle of refraction, and \(n\) is the refractive index.
The problem provides the distance from point P to the AC interface as \( \frac{\sqrt{3}R}{2} \) and the distance from point P to the BC interface as \( \frac{\sqrt{3}R}{3} \).
The angle of incidence \(i\) is calculated to be \(60^\circ\) based on the given distances and the geometry of the triangle formed.
The angle of refraction \(i'\) is determined to be \(30^\circ\) using the relationship \(i' = 90^\circ - i\).
Using Snell's Law \( \frac{\sin i}{\sin i'} = n \), the refractive index \(n\) of the glass column can be calculated.
